required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Revaccination With PNEUMOVAX(TM) 23 in Older Adults (V110-007)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open-Label Study of the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of Revaccination With PNEUMOVAX(TM) 23 Vaccine (Pneumococcal Vaccine Polyvalent, Merck & Co., Inc.) in Older Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine that revaccination of Pneumococcal Vaccine is well tolerated and produces an immune response in older adults.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is an extension study (V110-007-10) which met requirements for posting on clinicaltrials.gov. The original study (V110-007-00) was completed in 2004 and did not meet the criteria for registration.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Concentration for Prevaccination (Day 1) to Postvaccination (Day 30) During the Extension Phase Subjects Completing the Extension for Serotype 3
primary_outcome.description: Blood drawn at Day 1 and Day 30 of the extension study were used to measure IgG antibody levels to 8 pneumococcal polysaccharide serotypes (3, 4, 6B,8, 9V, 12F, 14, 23F) by ELISA.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Concentration for Prevaccination (Day 1) to Postvaccination (Day 30) During the Extension Phase Subjects Completing the Extension for Serotype 4
primary_outcome.description: Blood drawn at Day 1 and Day 30 of the extension study were used to measure IgG antibody levels to 8 pneumococcal polysaccharide serotypes (3, 4, 6B, 8, 9V, 12F, 14, 23F) by ELISA.

primary_outcome.description: Blood drawn at Day 1 and Day 30 of the extension study were used to measure IgG antibody levels to 8 pneumococcal polysaccharide serotypes (3, 4, 6B, 8, 9V, 12F, 14, 23F) by ELISA.

intervention.description: Duration of Treatment: Single vaccination on Day 1

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Postmenopausal or negative urine pregnancy test if female
- No fever on the day of vaccination
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of allergy to vaccine components
- History of pneumococcal disease
- Received any live virus vaccination within 4 weeks prior to study start
- Received any inactivated vaccination within 7 days prior to study start
- Received any blood products within 5 months prior to study start
- Participated in an investigational drug or vaccine study in the past 30 days
- Received immunosuppressive therapy
- Patient has an immune deficiency

results_reference.citation: Musher DM, Manoff SB, McFetridge RD, Liss CL, Marchese RD, Raab J, Rueda AM, Walker ML, Hoover PA. Antibody persistence ten years after first and second doses of 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine, and immunogenicity and safety of second and third doses in older adults. Hum Vaccin. 2011 Sep;7(9):919-28. doi: 10.4161/hv.7.9.15996. Epub 2011 Sep 1.

Manoff SB, Liss C, Caulfield MJ, Marchese RD, Silber J, Boslego J, Romero-Steiner S, Rajam G, Glass NE, Whitney CG, Carlone GM. Revaccination with a 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine induces elevated and persistent functional antibody responses in adults aged 65 > or = years. J Infect Dis. 2010 Feb 15;201(4):525-33. doi: 10.1086/651131.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was a Phase III study. The first patient was enrolled (FPE) on 13-Jul-2007. The last patient last visit (LPLV) was on 30-May-2008. A total of 5 US study centers were involved in the recruitment.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Base trial 4/97-4/98 Prior to results posted Initial: subjects received 1st or 2nd dose of PN23 Persistence: followed immune response 5 yrs; ended 4/03 Extension 7/07-4/08: enrolled 9-10 yrs after base. 1dose of PN23 Blood drawn Days 1&30, immune response to 8 serotypes measured 143 of 400 enrolled: difficulty enrolling eligible/interested subjects

group.title: 1st Revaccination Group
group.description: Received primary vaccination with Pneumovax 23 during the initial phase and 1st revaccination in the extension phase

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Open-label non-randomized group of subjects enrolled in this extension. Subjects recruited from original study which completed five years previously.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
